embeds.title: Worthy Sacrifice
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

**Exhaust** a card.
If it was Attack or Skill, gain a random card of the opposite type. (It costs 1 less.)

messages.content: 5 day streak
of uninterrupted daily discussions
this card is a weird form of consistency
the only reason it's not a nothing-burger is because of ghostflames
the upgrade can do funny things
like printing cantrips because of <hexaguard>

embeds.title: Hexaguard
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

**Ethereal**. **Afterlife.**
Gain 6 (9) **Block** :p_block:.
Draw 1 card.

messages.content: Ghostflame support card
If only there was a power card generator
tbh CAI would be nuts
I guess something that makes a token power could be ok
kindle is good but it's very clearly a starter card
time of need is alright but if you're taking it from a boss you're probably screwed
bolstering flame is tickled as an archetype.
time of need, forked flame, catch up...
remember old fast forward?
but if there was a way to renewably create powers
yeah
new fast forward is better though
new fast forward is just a better card
old fast forward was niche, had a weird upgrade, and could have strange stuff done with it

old fast forward was basically just "one free ignite please"
weird upgrade I agree
it never really became its own card after that revision,
it still felt very starter-y
new fast forward is more intuitive and supports ghostflames way better
I do agree new fast forward is a better card
draw = ghostflames, advance = ghostflames
skim adjacent
advance is worth a card draw
This is a really really strange card tbh
In my opinion without an upgrade it is just extremely bad

Spend 2 card draw to generate a random card. Not as bad thanks to it still activating afterlife, but afterlife decks don't really want this because A) it is really low impact and takes up draw, and
B) the cards it creates often are low impact and take up draw

The upgrade gives it an actual use case, as it can generate cantrips, or other cards that are cheaper than normal. Still really strange card though, in my opinion could use a rework, as I don't see much of a way to salvage this idea.
I think maybe make it draw a card of the opposite type and discount it similar to that one rare card on hermit (although from the draw pile, not discard)

Generating a random card is a really weird effect, and a random card that is -1 cost on a character with afterlife (doesn't care about the cost) feels so wild to me. You can get step through and just get a ton of free draw, or you can get flames from beyond and probably just let it exhaust anyway.
the point of the card is not to just activate afterlife but to also give you a card type that you need THAT turn
if it gave you a card that corresponded to the current ghostflame, it would be very strong
(powers for bolster and night or ignition cards for inferno)
but it still covers searing and crushing
it’s also for cantrip hunting to a certain extent
but this is stronger on snecko lol
~~even then snecko has shift so it’s roughly similar role as nope~~
<shift>

messages.content: so yeah, it’s basically nope
nope is… possibly usable
worthy sacrifice on hexa basically isn’t
snecko gets way more trash than hexaghost
because snecko lives in trash
so nope is naturally better
even then you see soul exchange once and never draft nope
i guess the main strength is being able to easily delete it with offclass for snecko lmao

I think that cards like worthy sacrifice shouldn't be everywhere and definitely not in common. There should be no easy solution to ignition and you should just either build your deck better or have more draw
just build it better yeah
with nope on snecko, you're constantly dealing with bad cards
i don’t think i drafted worthy sacrifice once within last 10 hexa runs at least
It's kind of alright
the main thing that holds it back is that you flow from attack into skill into power
so if you play it as a skill to get an attack, it itself as a zero cost skill isn't putting in that much worth, so its main use is on the crushing ghostflames
ideally, you're playing a lot of zero cost cards as hexaghost to get as much ghostflame value as possible
this card can do stuff like that but it in itself does not provide exceptional value, also usually just build your deck better
it is, however, very funny with fat draw and gifts from beyond
where you can pretend you have a very slow dead branch
I don't think it necesarily needs changes, it's immediate exhaust which is nice because you only get that from this and premonition, and premonition is more afterlife focused
<premonition>

embeds.title: Premonition
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 (0) :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Choose a card in your hand.
Play the chosen card and **Exhaust** it.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: these cards are kind of similar
why is ironclad stuck in hexaghost
in the formal art

pre·mo·ni·tion
/ˌprēməˈniSH(ə)n,ˌpreməˈniSH(ə)n/
noun
a strong feeling that something is about to happen, especially something unpleasant.
"he had a premonition of imminent disaster"
he's dead
or dying
or injured
it's a vision
of sorts

I disagree because it's super clunky, not straightforward at all, and when you do understand all of the weird niches it holds it is finally just a slightly below average card. It's very unappealing to low level players, mid level players, and high level players. It's extremely inconsistent in the results it gives when you could just make it draw a card of the opposite rarity instead of generate a random one. Very similar effect but way more consistent.

My idea would be this

Worthy Sacrifice
Uncommon Skill, 0 cost. Exhaust a card. If it was an attack or skill, draw 1(2) card(s) of the opposite type, they cost 1 less this turn.
Removes the awkward cantrip hunting this causes, makes the base form better and the upgrade slightly worse in some situations, better in others.
0 cost draw
why
Oh wait yeah upgraded is a cantrip
and it makes how important balance is on hexaghost way less important
why balance attacks and skills when you have targeted violence
a card can be weird and kind of niche, hexaghost already has some decent bnb
Well is that not what the whole point of the card is??

it's a weird afterlife ghostflame support card, not "I don't want to have to balance cards anymore by drawing the exact cards I need where I know what I'm getting instead of something random every time"
you made <gambit>

embeds.description:

Put 2 (3) random Attacks from your discard pile into your hand. They cost 1 less this turn.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: but targeted
and seek
taking cards from your draw pile is way stronger than your discard
and you can easily get attacks or skills
the main downside of worthy sacrifice is that the card is random, but the idea is that it will get the job done
with taking a card from your draw pile you have a very, very good idea of what you're getting, and it's insane acceleration
I can make a deck as fast as I can play cards with that
<violence> btw

embeds.title: Violence
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 0 :colorless_energy: / Colorless / Slay the Spire

Put 3 (4) random Attacks from your draw pile into your hand.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: I agree my proposition may be a bit strong, but this current one doesn't really do much and is very rarely taken, extremely niche and most people do not place much value in it.
violence ft. miracle+
there's nothing wrong with a card that's jank and not taken all the time
not everything needs to be goodstuff
I mean, I think there is when most people just kinda write it off. Even at what you claim it does, it doesn't even do super well at.
Ask most hexa players and I think most would say they rarely take this if ever.
and there's not really anything wrong with that
I take this maybe once every 10-15 runs.
I don't think it necesarily needs changes unless you wanted to make it more distinct from premonition.

I mean, I disagree with this sentiment. I think for a niche card to work it should have something that nothing else can supply, like the old bad omen. Nothing could replace it, nothing works similarly to it. Worthy Sacrifice's effect is not niche, it's just really underwhelming.
every common card should be pommel strike, every uncommon card should be fear no evil, and every rare card should be echo form
it's one of the few hexaghost cards that creates cards on play renewably
Literal definition and example of a strawman argument. Take what I say and turn it up to the maximum and then disprove that point.
is it necessary? no, but it's not untakeable
tis a jest
don't take it too seriously
Fair point, I should calm down a bit, I apologize.
it's not a bad card it just has limited use cases, if you made it better it would make hexaghost less focused on balance
it's as best as you can do as a ghostflame support in hand instead of 0 cost draw
and 0 cost draw should not exist on hexaghost period, it's ignoring the whole point of the character
draw on hexaghost should be relics and a couple of cards that already require having balance
and then mos
step through requires you to have already built a deck that balances attacks and skills, or it takes too long, and it still costs energy
so it's more about going faster, getting more advance, getting more afterlife

I see your sentiment, however I think if we try to bring the character close to balance some stuff would have to be nerfed, so some other stuff being slightly buffed would be fine. I agree my idea was too strong, but currently it is draw negative and doesn't really achieve enough to justify that in my opinion, and from other people sharing their opinions in this channel it looks like others share that opinion.
it doesn't have the cost reduction of premonition but it flat out creates a card
a card that can create cards infinitely will always have SOME niche
Yes but creating random cards isn't exactly the healthiest mechanic in my opinion, which is why I suggested draw.
zero cost draw, especially targeted draw should be exclusive to rare cards and the colorless pool
and I believe that zero cost draw should not exist in hexaghost's master deck at all
this is an uncommon card
it lowers the fact that hexaghost appreciates the 0 cost cards in the colorless pool far more than other characters
why take flash of steel when you can just draw out the cards you need by just exhausting an afterlife card early

The fact that most people see this card, and the primary way they use it is to generate a cantrip is a bit problematic to me. The difference between generating something lower impact like a <phantom fireball> compared to a <step through> permanently discounted to 0 cost is too much.

1) the random card inconsistencies
2) the card basically NEEDS to high roll to feel valuable
I mean, so does infernal blade.
Nic200's point is that infernal blade is also shit
Yes and I don't like infernal blade, and if I could change it I would.

embeds.title: Ghost Shield
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

**Ethereal**. **Afterlife.**
Gain 7 (10) **Block** :p_block:.
When **Exhaust**ed,
gain 1 **Blur** :p_blur:.

messages.content: ideally, you would be exhausting an afterlife attack, but specter's wail is keepable in a lot of fights, and ghost lash is a meme

Discord mobile update challenge: actually work


difficulty level: impossible
I often exhaust an attack with it so I only need to play 1 skill to activate my crushing ghostflame.
Pretty sure it was mentioned in a hexa discussion in #deleted-channel too

It's a cool idea for a card, a 0 cost skill that can help proc ghostflames by turning attacks into skills and vice versa. Definitely useful if your deck has enough advance cards in it to potentially move around the wheel and try to proc 2 or 3 ghostflames in the same turn. The output randomness of the generated card can be pretty swingy though, especially since you've exhausted the original target. There are plenty of relatively weak attacks/skills that this can make, and unless you are exclusively exhausting strikes/defends, there is a chance that it actively makes your deck worse. In theory you could use this to react to enemy intents, like trying to create an additional attack on a safe turn where no one is attacking you, or making an additional skill that hopefully blocks on a turn where you are being attacked for a lot. In practice, that's going to lead to very inconsistent results, and the card disadvantage of worthy sacrifice makes it very inefficient.

Anytime you use this, you are basically going down a card in hand, which is a significant cost, especially considering that the card it generates is already completely random. That alone makes it a very unappealing choice in most situations. I just think that there are much easier ways to proc your ghostflames than this (forked flame, catch up, fast forward). It's also a low impact skill for gremlin nob, the chosen, and watcher 3. The upgrade is very interesting, making the card cost 1 less definitely helps stop this from making your deck worse as a result of casting it. However, you could still just generate a bad card, a card that exhausts, or a card that already costs 0. I think worthy sacrifice+ is much more takeable, but I wouldn't use an upgrade on it in a run.

One possible buff would be to reword it so that exhausting non attacks/skills (with status/curse being the big ones) generated something. It could say "Exhaust a card. If it was an attack, gain a random skill. If it wasn't, gain a random attack."
One of the most busted cards in the mod, if I'm ever playing tiny deck hexaghost its probably abusing this

Targeted exhaust for 0 on its own is powerful on its own on hexa, because there are so many afterlife cards that activate when you exhaust them there are interesting things you can do with this that aren't otherwise apparent. Thinning your deck of weak starter cards is neat and random card generation is neat, skills playing for 0 and doing something on this character is neat but the main event is obviously the upgrade

Repeatedly playing this card with the help of [[rewind]] and just dedicating the rest of your turn to card draw is a very powerful strategy, it can generate a lot of output for 0 on a character that otherwise doesn't have much energy. It gives you permanently discounted super cards while thinning your deck of stuff that isn't a permanently discounted super card

embeds.title: Rewind
embeds.description:
Special Skill / 5 :colorless_energy: / Black / Hubris

**Innate** (Grave).
Replay every card you've played this combat.
Purge.

messages.content: As such, you can expect to go infinite with this card fairly quickly but it obviously isn't guaranteed. With an effect so strong, you don't really need to.
The one downside is this is the hexaghost who can get multiple card rewards a combat the character has like a thousand other broken mechanics
Huh wow, that is an opinion very different from my take on the card, and very different from Blue Guy's.

I think on a character with afterlife and ethereal powers, your deck naturally thins pretty well on its own, and it's negative on card draw as well, and the random card can just very well be <phantom fireball> or something else pretty bad.

embeds.title: Phantom Fireball
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 0 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Deal 4 (7) damage.
If the enemy has Soulburn, detonate it.

messages.content: Still better than phantom fireball, its both a skill and an attack for activating the Ghostflame. If the worst case is it being on par with a damage common, thats makes it an act 1 card that does things late
My experience with it is it can regularly be the focus of your deck if you lean into playing it repeatedly
Most cards in this game are negative on card draw, I think this one has an effect cheap and powerful enough to warrant taking
Most are, but this is also very low impact when unupgraded.
Most act 1 cards don't really need an upgrade, as if you don't have much else you really want something you can add to your deck for instant frontload.

When unupgraded I think it is way too weak, when upgraded I think it's probably just alright, although I must admit I definitely haven't tried using it much, especially in the ways you described, so I definitely want to check it out now.

It's very rare that I see an opinion that different than mine where it makes me want to try it out to see what I'm missing out on, usually when I see a differing opinion I argue with Blue guy for 15 minutes and move on
